codeExplanation.speaker: Pixel
codeExplanation.text: Let me explain the main parts of your game code!
multiStep: First, we import PyGame and set up the game window. This creates the screen where your game appears!
Then we load all your assets - the sprites, sounds, and backgrounds you chose. PyGame turns these into objects we can move around!
The game loop runs 60 times per second, checking for player input, moving things, and drawing everything!
Collision detection checks when things touch - like when the player hits an enemy or collects a gem!
Finally, we update the display to show all the changes. And that's how your game comes to life!
